task_summary: Perceive the T-block and the goal outline, align the circular end-effector, make gentle contact, then push the block toward the fixed target and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A UR-style robot with a circular end-effector must push a T-shaped block across a white tabletop until it aligns with a fixed blue T-outline. The sequence begins with vision-based detection of the block and the goal, approaches to a safe height, aligns yaw, and establishes light contact. The robot then performs one or more straight pushes to translate the block toward the outline, verifying goal proximity after each push. The process emphasizes stable contact, controlled distances, and modest timeouts at 10 Hz perception/control.
preconditions: Workspace clear except for the T-block and goal outline
Robot reachable workspace includes start and goal
End-effector circular and suitable for planar pushing
stepwise_plan: Move above the block and set yaw for side pushing.
Align to block edge and lower until contact.
Execute a push along the planned direction.
Briefly wait, then check if block is at goal.
Retry push sequence up to three attempts if needed.
success_criteria: Block pose overlaps the goal outline within visual tolerance
No loss of contact stability during pushes
Robot ends in a safe, retracted pose
failure_and_recovery: If detection fails: re-run detection or widen search.
If misaligned contact occurs: re-approach and realign.
If push under-shoots: perform another push cycle.
If overshoot: re-approach from opposite side with adjusted direction (not encoded here).
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the goal condition IsAt(target_goal) succeeds and the robot has retreated.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Detect a named object or goal in the scene.
Move above a target at a specified vertical offset.
Rotate the tool yaw to align pushing direction.
Laterally approach and align to the target within tolerance.
Lower in Z until contact is detected.
Push the target along a straight line.
Small pause to stabilize perception/control at 10 Hz.
Check if current object pose coincides with the symbolic goal.
Back away from the workspace after completion.

failure_modes: Object not detected due to occlusion or lighting
Insufficient contact leading to no motion
Collision with table fixtures or cables
recovery_strategy: Repeat perception and widen search pattern
Approach from the opposite side if overshoot occurs
Retreat and re-plan if unexpected contact spikes
assumptions: Frames show a red T-block and blue goal outline; instruction mentions gray/green—visuals were prioritized.
Pushing direction set to 90° based on apparent lateral goal direction; could vary per episode.
Contact and depth thresholds chosen heuristically; the dataset does not expose calibrated forces.
IsAt(target_goal) abstracts visual alignment within outline; exact metric not provided.

expected_success_criteria: IsAt(target_goal) returns success after a push cycle
No aborts from timeouts in approach and contact steps
